alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 2:26PM CDT until June 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Oklahoma, including the following counties, Beckham, Custer, Roger Mills and Washita. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the last 6 hours. Some of these areas have received up to 5 inches over the last 24 hours. - Prolonged light to moderate rainfall is expected in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elk City, Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss, Foss Reservoir and Stafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
